summary:
This fixes a possible security concern (reported by Feross Aboukhadijeh) where
user input is passed unchecked to the Buffer constructor or `allocUnsafe()` as
it can expose parts of the memory slab used by other Buffers in the application.
Note that negative lengths are not supported by the Buffer API and user input to
the constructor should always be sanitised and type-checked.
details: Ignore negative lengths in calls to `Buffer()` and `Buffer.allocUnsafe()`.
